author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In realms of sight we delve and peer,
A closer look doth draw us near,
Myst'ries deep and wonders rife,
Unveil their face through clear lens' eye.

To shadows long we turn our gaze,
Once more our world a hov'rings ménage,
Amidst spectrals gloom and fog,
Emerge the truths obscurest fog.

Yet one more glance to see the sight,
A world transformed on wings of light,
In haste do we discover anew,
This final closer look reveals the truth.

feedItems.content: Selections from ‘How Birds Sleep’ by David Obuchowski, illustrated by Sarah Pedry
feedItems.contentSnippet: Selections from ‘How Birds Sleep’ by David Obuchowski, illustrated by Sarah Pedry

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In travails of yon Guo Wengui, swear,
A bail denied, despair laid bare,
In New York's stead he faced his trial,
Merriment denied, like tear-full vial.

Beseech'd in earnest, prithee, eyes,
Upon events, a closer prize,
Yet insights spar'd to hearts now stir,
In courtly guise, melodies inferred.

Transformation of our Earth, alas,
Doom's day delay'd, dread times to pass,
A song of hope, tho' sadden'd pleas,
A bard must sing in gentle breeze.

feedItems.title: Guo Wengui Denied Bail While Awaiting Trial in New York
feedItems.content: The exiled Chinese businessman has been in jail on fraud and money-laundering charges since March.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The exiled Chinese businessman has been in jail on fraud and money-laundering charges since March.

feedItems.content: Selections from ‘How Old is a Whale?’ by Lily Murray, illustrated by Jesse Hodgson
feedItems.contentSnippet: Selections from ‘How Old is a Whale?’ by Lily Murray, illustrated by Jesse Hodgson

feedItems.title: 'The Earth Transformed' Review: Doom May Be Delayed
feedItems.content: For eons, human civilizations have shaped—and been shaped by—the natural world.
feedItems.contentSnippet: For eons, human civilizations have shaped—and been shaped by—the natural world.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Ritchie's tale, The Covenant I sing,
In Afghan lands, where action doth spring,
As wine that flows from Heaven's bounteous vine,
Their skirmish fierce, akin to stoutest wine.

And of young seedlings in the garden bright,
Children's tales that dance like starry night,
As scriptural ale, their minds nourish well,
From Heavenly vat, where sweetest musings dwell.

Now raise a toast to Ford, that Ordinary wight,
Deemed simpleton by those of fiendish sight,
Yet in his reign, a blessed mead he brought,
Much like a vintage ale, with wisdom fraught.

feedItems.title: 'Guy Ritchie's The Covenant' Review: Action in Afghanistan
feedItems.content: The British director’s unusually straightforward new film stars Jake Gyllenhaal as an American sergeant navigating Taliban-riddled territory with a local interpreter.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The British director’s unusually straightforward new film stars Jake Gyllenhaal as an American sergeant navigating Taliban-riddled territory with a local interpreter.

feedItems.title: Children's Books: Seedlings of the Imagination
feedItems.content: Reviews of ‘Big Tree,’ ‘Arborama,’ ‘Wings, Waves & Webs,’ ‘ How Old Is a Whale?’ and ‘How Birds Sleep.’
feedItems.contentSnippet: Reviews of ‘Big Tree,’ ‘Arborama,’ ‘Wings, Waves & Webs,’ ‘ How Old Is a Whale?’ and ‘How Birds Sleep.’

feedItems.title: 'An Ordinary Man' Review: Underestimating Gerald Ford
feedItems.content: Listening more than talking, the 38th president guided America through a tumultuous era. He receives too little credit for it.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Listening more than talking, the 38th president guided America through a tumultuous era. He receives too little credit for it.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Lo! A striking serpent soars the sky,
Unnamed heroes, doomed vessel's flight,
Alas, the Starship's fall shall lie,
Great SpaceX's pyre ignites.

In halls of labor, warriors tire,
Yet for these Æsir, timeless brawls,
Their fateful quest, not once retire,
An endless fray amidst work's walls.

Foreboding storms assail the air,
Beneath the skies, malicious shade,
Europe's flight-wrights in black despair,
As pro-Russian specters raid.

feedItems.title: SpaceX's Starship Explodes Shortly After Launching Uncrewed Test Flight
feedItems.content: Starship launched successfully but exploded a few minutes later, ending the inaugural flight of a vehicle Elon Musk wants to use for deep-space missions.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Starship launched successfully but exploded a few minutes later, ending the inaugural flight of a vehicle Elon Musk wants to use for deep-space missions.

feedItems.title: When Will I Retire? How About Never
feedItems.content: For many people, the idea of stopping work is a nonstarter—an inevitable path to boredom, ill health and a life devoid of meaning.
feedItems.contentSnippet: For many people, the idea of stopping work is a nonstarter—an inevitable path to boredom, ill health and a life devoid of meaning.

feedItems.title: Europe's Air-Traffic Agency Under Attack From Pro-Russian Hackers
feedItems.content: Air traffic isn’t at risk but the attack is ongoing, Eurocontrol said, amid fears about the safety of Europe’s critical infrastructure.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Air traffic isn’t at risk but the attack is ongoing, Eurocontrol said, amid fears about the safety of Europe’s critical infrastructure.
